1.text: Slide the pops into an upside-down colander for an easy-to-clean option.

2.text: Pierce holes in an upside-down egg carton for an easy alternative.
2.vid: /0/0c/Make a Cake Pop Holder Step 7 Version 2.360p.mp4

3.text: Fill a wide-mouth jar with candies or coffee beans.
3.vid: /5/5e/Make a Cake Pop Holder Step 8 Version 2.360p.mp4

4.text: Make your own cake stand by drilling holes into a piece of wood.
4.vid: /1/1c/Make a Cake Pop Holder Step 9 Version 2.360p.mp4

5.text: Decorate a box or a basket if you want to use one.

6.text: Cut your styrofoam to fit snugly in the basket or box.
6.vid: /2/24/Make a Cake Pop Holder Step 2 Version 2.360p.mp4

7.text: Wrap the styrofoam neatly in tissue paper.
7.vid: /1/15/Make a Cake Pop Holder Step 3 Version 2.360p.mp4

8.text: Place the styrofoam inside the box or basket.
8.vid: /1/19/Make a Cake Pop Holder Step 4 Version 2.360p.mp4

9.text: Push the cake pop sticks down through the foam block.
